message.body: Mike! How's your application? Move to boston or stay in pony land?
I'm still working on the application. I've been agonizing over the statement of purpose.
How are you doing?
Agonizing over lots of stuff... I got finished with a show I've been curating since the fall. So now I'm trying to catch up on homework. Lots of projects.
What's the statement of purpose? Just a general statement?
Why I want to do the program and what my goals are and such. Kind of like asking what do you want to do with your life. I pretty much know what I want to say but I'm not a good writer.
What was the show?
Keep it simple writing is so hard
The show was interactive media design. It actually was a nightmare to put together.
And it didn't turn out so hot so I'm super happy to move on
Sorry I fell asleep last night before I could respond to your last text. Hope you don't think I was rude. I'm sorry you weren't happy with your show. What's next?

Oh it's ok about the show. Other people were really happy with it. Just me being mean and critical. Next for catching up on homework, planning the summer... I'm psyched I got a meeting with a prof from MIT tomorrow. I heard he might have a project for me!
Oh and it's going to be warm out! Ill be able to paint outside
I just went to my first ever Passover dinner.
Awesome. Where'd you go?
My housemate took me to his friends' house in west Philly. Everyone there was involved in social justice and had really awesome things to say relating Jewish history to things going on today
Nice. What they say about Jewish history? What did you guys eat?
Ponies?
No ponies. Almost all of the food was vegan.
A lot of very serious political stuff about oppression and slavery.
So west Philly. I'm glad it's still similar to how I remember.
I didn't go to a Seder this year but I did hear a funny joke
About Matzah. Did you have any?
I'm curious though, what were they referring to.
Passover is my favorite holiday
ï¿¼Look at this sign I saw today.
I had lots of matzah
Because of the rituals, songs, and stories
The story of freedom and persistence
They talked a lot about how their ancestors experience of being oppressed gave them an obligation to support other oppressed people
What is the difference between matzah and cardboard?
Cardboard doesn't make crumbs
Oh I like that!
I like the sign and the sentiment
I liked the songs too.

One woman told a story about going to buenos aires with her mother were a lot of her mothers friends had been disappeared and seeing graffiti that said "the only struggles you lose are the ones you abandon." It was really moving.
Mmmmmm nice. I gotta sleep. Talk more later.
Ok. Sweet dreams
